rules: Rule1: Provided that the publication is approved, the operation will be compliant.
Rule2: Given that an environmental assessment is conducted in the region, a safety inspection is conducted at the facility.
Rule3: A safety inspection at the facility leads to material testing being performed on the material.
Rule4: Material testing on the material results in community approval being granted for the region.
Rule5: Community approval for the region ensures that the mining operation is permitted if it meets requirements.
Rule6: Certification of the facility means it is operational.
Rule7: Either the facility is certified or it has a temporary permit.
Rule8: Issuance of a temporary permit for the facility necessitates emergency repairs being conducted there.
Rule9: Approval of the document results in the operation being compliant.
Rule10: An open investigation for the company means that a compliance extension is not granted.
Rule11: A routine audit at the facility leads to the operation being compliant.
Rule12: A routine audit is conducted at the facility or a special inspection is conducted there.
Rule13: If an appeal is filed by the company, then the penalty being waived follows from the absence of the special inspection leading to compliance.
Rule14: Retention of legal counsel by the company leads to an appeal being filed.
Rule15: Self-representation by the company leads to an appeal being filed.
Rule16: Submission of the publication results in its approval.
Rule17: The publication is submitted or the document is submitted.
Rule18: Submission of evidence by the company prevents a default judgment.
Rule19: Evidence is submitted by the company or testimony is provided by the company.
Rule20: Provision of testimony by the company prevents a default judgment.
Rule21: Either the license is revoked for the company, or the license is suspended, or the operation is compliant.
Rule22: A valid permit for the company means its license is not revoked.
Rule23: The company has a pending renewal, or an expired permit, or a valid permit.
Rule24: If an attorney files for the company, then dismissal is granted provided that the environmental complaint does not lead to the hazard report implying emergency repairs result in compliance.
Rule25: Submission of the document leads to its review.
Rule26: If the company files pro se, then dismissal is granted provided that the environmental complaint does not lead to the hazard report implying emergency repairs result in compliance.
Rule27: Completion of the appeal for the company implies that either an attorney filed or the company filed pro se.
Rule28: A violation is proven against the company or a default judgment is not entered.
Rule29: Presentation of counter evidence by the company prevents a violation from being proven.
Rule30: Provision of witness testimony by the company prevents a violation from being proven.
Rule31: Submission of an expert report by the company leads to counter evidence being presented.
Rule32: An expert report is submitted by the company or an employee statement is provided.
Rule33: Notarization of the company’s documents means that an employee statement leads to witness testimony.
Rule34: The company’s documents are notarized or verified.
Rule35: Verification of the company’s documents means that an employee statement leads to witness testimony.
Rule36: A renewal application is submitted by the company or an automatic extension is granted.
Rule37: An automatic extension for the company leads to a valid permit.
Rule38: Approval of the renewal for the company means that a renewal application leads to a valid permit.
Rule39: Possibility of an appeal for the company leads to denial of the renewal.
Rule40: Rejection of the document leads to rejection of the publication.
Rule41: Permission of the mining operation leads to compliance of the operation.
Rule42: Application for the mining operation leads to it meeting requirements.
Rule43: Absence of a violation notice or the hazard report implying emergency repairs lead to compliance results in a compliance extension.
Rule44: Absence of legal counsel or self-representation leads to a default judgment.
Rule45: Absence of the review leading to approval results in rejection of the document.
Rule46: Denial of renewal approval leads to possibility of an appeal.
Rule47: Denial of renewal approval leads to the renewal not being denied.
facts: Fact1: An environmental assessment is conducted in the region.
Fact2: A hazard report is filed for the region.
Fact3: An investigation is open for the company.
Fact4: An environmental complaint is filed for the region.
Fact5: The appeal is complete for the company.
Fact6: The mining operation is applied for.
Fact7: The facility is not operational.
Fact8: A violation notice is not issued to the company.
Fact9: The penalty is not waived for the company.
Fact10: The license is not suspended for the company.
Fact11: The company does not have an expired permit.
Fact12: The company does not have a pending renewal.
Fact13: Dismissal is not granted for the company.
Fact14: The publication is not rejected.
